results.title: Treasure of the forest
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and Roger Blais
results.brief_description: This film about the industries that draw their wealth from the raw material supplied by Canada’s forests shows how this wealth is being preserved by a long-term conservation program. Filmed in the rain forests of the British Columbia coast, it shows how giant conifers are felled, transported by water routes to sawmills, and cut into lumber or reduced to Canada’s greatest single export, newsprint. Realization of the need for conservation has led to an extensive program of aerial stocktaking and a system of planned cutting and reforestation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and Roger Blais

results.title: Treasure Island
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Perce Pearce and Byron Haskin
results.brief_description: A rousing, live-action adventure, based on Robert Louis Stevenson’s classic story. Young Jim Hawkins possesses a map of Treasure Island, and sets sail with a ship full of gold seekers. However, Long John Silver, a greedy crewman, quickly masterminds a mutiny, then gathers a ragged band of pirates to resume the treasure hunt…with young Hawkins as their unwilling and terrified hostage. Stars Robert Newton and Bobby Driscoll.

results.title: Treasure Island
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Robert Louis Stevenson, the story of Jim Hawkin’s hair-raising journey across the High Seas, complete with treasure maps, mystery and Long John Silver.

results.title: Treasure Island
results.creator_credit: Burbank Films Australia, Roz Phillips and Warwick Gilbert
results.brief_description: When an old sea dog Billy Bones dies at the “Admiral Benbow Inn”, Jim Hawkins and Dr. Liversey come into possession of a map revealing the where- abouts of treasure hidden by the infamous Captain Kidd. They set out on the sailing ship “Hispaniola” to find the hoard and make their fortunes. In the great tradition of swashbuckling adventure stories Robert Louis Stevenson’s tale has taken its place among the best known and most widely read by children of all ages. Ross Higgins stars as the voice of Long John Silver and brings this animated video to life.

results.title: Treasure in the pyramid
results.creator_credit: Kratky Film, Marta Sichova and Vaclav Bedrich
results.brief_description: An animated parody of the “thriller” serials of the silent film era. The intrepid hero Lucius and his sweetheart Zea run foul of a sinister band of robbers who are plotting to steal the hidden treasure in an ancient Mayan pyramid. Heroic rescues, overwhelming odds, and fates worse than death are all part of the plot.

results.title: Treasure gardens with Alan Titchmarsh
results.creator_credit: Tadpole Lane and Treasure House Group
results.brief_description: Gardening expert Alan Titchmarsh takes you on an armchair journey through the grounds and gardens of eight of England’s historic houses. Included on the journey are the Broadlands in Derbyshire, Palace in On Walk at Harewood House; Yorkshire, Castle Howard, the Beaulieu estate in Hampshire, Woburn Abbey in Bedfordshire and the Peacock and Rose Gardens at Warwick Castle. Rhododendrle]

results.title: Treasure from the sea
results.brief_description: The Dow-perfected process of manufacturing magnesium by using a formula in which sea-water is a component is shown in this film. The effects of a wider use of magnesium in industrial and domestic life are also shown, and the advantages for both producer and consumer are presented.

results.title: Treadle and bobbin (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The machine, in one form or another, has become such a household necessity that we tend to forget the wonder and magic of the days when it was just beginning to earn its place by the hearth. The first suave ambassador from the court of mechanical efficiency to woo and win Grandma’s heart was the redoubtable sewing machine. Whirring and purring in the parlour, its virtuoso performance beguiled both young and old. Without commentary.

results.title: Tread softly
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Di Drew and Rolf De Heer
results.brief_description:
Claire (Robyn Nevin) and Angela (Natalie Bate) have only been been living together for a short time but Claire’s constant attention has already become suffocating to Angela. She needs space and time to be alone.
The painful final stages of an affair that is over but not yet finished.

results.title: Trawling
results.brief_description: An account of methods used by British trawlers; map showing ports from which trawling is carried on; views of port and preparations for trip; leaving the port; preparing the nets; shooting a net; action of net under water and how fish are caught; hauling in the net; gutting and packing the fish; landing the catch.
